paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the identification of small-molecule ion channel modulators in C. elegans models, focusing on the KCNH2 gene and its variants, particularly A561V, in the context of Long-QT syndrome.

functional_data.summary: The A561V mutation causes trafficking defects in hERG channels, leading to reduced surface expression and function. Prostratin and IDB were identified as functional correctors that enhance trafficking and function of the mutant channels.

variants.additional_notes: The A561V mutation is known to cause strong dominant-negative suppression of wild-type hERG protein trafficking.
key_quotes: The A561V mutation is known to cause strong dominant-negative suppression of wild-type hERG (hERGWT) protein trafficking, resulting in reduced channel function at the surface.

challenges: No individual-level penetrance data was provided in the paper.
extraction_metadata.notes: The paper primarily focuses on functional assays and the identification of small-molecule correctors for the A561V variant in KCNH2.
